CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 26, 1957, pg. 15, reads: "Wedding Bells Ring for Many District Couples! Mr. and Mrs. Richelieu Davis Jr...'Teenie' Harris photo." Article reads: "SOLOMON - DAVIS Miss Vivian Solomon selected an eighteenth century gown for her marriage to Richelieu Davis Jr. at Mt. Ararat Baptist Church.  The Rev. Clarence A. Burrell officiated.  Given in marriage by her father, Marvin Solomon, the bride's gown of white silk shantung was styled like those of Martha Washington's day.  She carried a bouquet of lilies of the valley with an orchid in center.  Miss Alma R. Frazier was maid of honor. Bridesmaids were the Misses Nancy Gaddie, Shirley Gardner, Ann Morton and Gwendolyn Johnson.  Donnell Parham of Richmond, Va., was best man.  Ushers were Arthur Coles of New York, James Black, James Carey, Lathia Gaddie, Olen Land and Alvin Wiillis [Willis]. Marvel Harper and Cassandra Powell were flower girls.  Clifford Kelly, ringbearer, Miss Julia Betts was soloist, and Miss Juanita Saunders, organist.  Mrs. Ruth Lee directed the wedding."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of wedding party with six women, including Nancy Gaddie, Shirley Gardner, Ann Morton, Gwendolyn Johnson, maid of honor Alma T. Frazier, and bride Vivian Solomon Davis wearing long sleeved v-neck gown; eight men, including Arthur Coles, James Black, James Carey, Lathia Gaddie, Olen Land, Alvin Willis, best man Donnell Parham, and groom Richelieu Davis Jr. wearing light colored dinner jacket with dark lapels; flower girls Marvel Harper and Cassandra Powell; and ring bearer Clifford Kelly, posed in Mt. Ararat Baptist Church, another version
